commitResults.messageTitle: Update highlightjs method call syntax for inline code (#1691)
Fix footer margin on medium viewports (#1692)
Update projectStructure.md (#1695)
Enhance appearance of minimised panels (#1694)
commitResults.messageBody:
* Add caret icon (as most minimised panels tend to use a caret icon to
show that it is a clickable button

* Add top margin (as expanded cards also have a top margin but not a
bottom margin, top margin was chosen. This is to prevent ugly cluttering)

commitResults.messageTitle: Optimise search input size (#1760)
Improve deployment documentation (site.json + deployment files) (#1789)
commitResults.messageBody:
* Minor documentation improvements for consistency
* Also changes panels from minimal to seamless for user convenience
* Adds page navigation to siteJsonFile due to the length of the page,
this also serves as a helpful summary.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs: Remove index.md files from being searched (#1805)
Fix missing images from plugin page (#1711)
Add relative links to template file (#1728)
Hotfix for appveyor npm upgrade (#1747)
Resolve bug regarding backslashes in convert feature (#1742)
Fix convert command generating extra newline (#1746)
Remove `.mbdf` and `.mbd` as markbind supported file extensions (#1762)
commitResults.messageBody:
Syntax parsers do not work with `.mbdf` and `.mbd` and
this functionality could be implemented using other means (e.g. pagesExclude)

Refer to this for the full discussion #1672.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve SettingUp documentation (#1795)
Pin colorsjs at version 1.4.0 (#1705)
Update markdown-it version and relevant patches (#1701)
commitResults.messageBody:
A minor bug in markdown-it-attrs prevents the addition
of multiple classes for the hr elements. Its latest version
fixes the issue.

Let's update the version of the plugin and the core
markdown-it package to fix the above-mentioned bug.

commitResults.messageTitle: Give easy ways to add different types of horizontal lines (#1685)
commitResults.messageBody:
No convenient syntax is available to style the hr element.

Let's add some helper classes for the hr element to
improve its style.

Users may use a combination of the available classes and
BootStrap border-color classes to customize the look of
the hr element.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix PageNav raw variable interpolation syntax display (#1724)
commitResults.messageBody:
The raw variable interpolation syntax can be displayed
by wrapping it with {% raw %} {% endraw %}. Even though
the {{ content }} is showing up correctly in the main page,
the generated PageNav text retains {{}} and causes vue
to incorrectly hide it due to rendering error.

Let's add a v-pre attribute whenever there is {{}} in
the navigation text.

This will allow content wrapped {{}} to display in PageNav.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add documentation on indentation support for components (#1719)
commitResults.messageBody:
Users may need to indent components to align with nearby
content.

Let's add in a section in 'tips and tricks' to show examples
of how to indent components with bootstrap utility classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add v-pre to all anchor elements in pageNav (#1732)
commitResults.messageBody:
v-pre is added to anchor elements of pageNav on a need basis
to escape raw {} syntax.

Let's instead add v-pre to all pageNav anchor elements to
keep it simple and performant.

commitResults.messageTitle: Adjust line numbers setting for code blocks (#1734)
commitResults.messageBody:
Line numbers are provided by default and there is no way
to override it globally.

Let's include a codeLineNumbers option in site.json to
enable a global configuration of line numbers. Line numbers
are also now hidden by default.

This is more convenient for authors as line numbers tend to
be hidden manually in practice. This is also consistent with other
markdown renderers.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix docs formatting and typo (#1750)
Update CI to test on all major OS and remove Appveyor (#1757)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, we are using GitHub actions and Appveyor to
run tests for PRs.

Let's remove the use of Appveyor and consolidate CI tests
in GitHub actions. Let's also update the setup-node action
version.

commitResults.messageTitle: Move docs deployment from Travis CI to GitHub Actions (#1759)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is a change to Travis' pricing model.

Let's move docs deployment into GitHub Actions and remove
the usage of Travis from our CI processes.

This will potentially remove any costs incurred when using Travis.

commitResults.messageTitle: Disabling deploy-docs on forks to fix CI errors (#1765)
Disable fuzzy link and mention autolink feature in UG (#1779)
Add badges to README.md (#1785)
Fix tipBox content overflow (#1787)
commitResults.messageBody: Fix tipBox content overflow with min-width

commitResults.messageTitle: Update workflow and project structure of devGuide (#1786)
Add margin above code block headers (#1706)
Deprecate attributes for Dropdown, Box, Popover, Modal (#1722)
Fix typo in docs for Tooltips (#1758)
commitResults.messageBody: Fix typo in docs for tooltips

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow reactivity in popovers and tooltips (#1748)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, popovers and tooltips are implemented using bootstrap-vue 
directives. 

Such an implementation is not reactive which limits the content that 
can be used in a popover/tooltip. Reactivity is important for future 
enhancements like supporting the src attribute (#59). Furthermore, it 
is incompatible with SSR, resulting in hydration problems that have 
arisen in #1615.

Using Vue components for tooltips and popovers, and Portals for 
triggers, allows us to avoid the issues with reactivity and SSR. 

Let's use components instead of bootstrap-vue directives to implement 
popovers and tooltips. This gives better support of reactivity while 
avoiding SSR issues.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update outdated information in docs  (#1777)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the effect attribute is not implemented in popovers and 
tooltips, which means that using this attribute has no effect. 
However, the effect attribute is currently included in the examples 
for popovers. This may be confusing for readers. 

Let's remove all occurrences of the effect attribute from the docs 
in places where it has no effect. This will prevent readers from 
mistaking it as a valid attribute. 

Other minor grammatical errors were fixed as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove unused effect attribute from tests (#1783)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the effect attribute is not implemented for both popovers 
and tooltips. However, it is included in some of the tests for these 
components. This may be confusing and clutter the codebase. 

Let's remove the effect attribute from these tests, to avoid confusion 
on whether or not this is a valid attribute.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement src attribute for popovers (#1780)
commitResults.messageBody:
Content can be supplied to popovers through either the content slot, or
content attribute.

Manually providing popover contents may be inconvenient if an author
wants to reference content from elsewhere on the site. 

Let's implement the src attribute for popovers, so that authors can
reference content from source files. This is more convenient for
authors, while helping to ensure consistency in website contents.

Using the src attribute maintains consistency with other components such
as Panels and Includes, which also use src.

The src attribute was implemented with a static approach to avoid
potential positioning issues. In the case that multiple contents are
supplied, the following priority is used: content slot > content
attribute > src attribute.
